intro: Leontodon variegatus, commonly known as the variable hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Leontodon variegatus is often found in disturbed sites, indicating its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
